member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.CreateToken.CreateTokenMethod(System.String,Dapper.API.Models.TokenData)
member.summary: User specific token

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.CreateToken.CreateTokenMethod(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Dapper.API.Models.TokenData)
member.summary: Device specific token

member.name: T:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken
member.summary: Interface for token creation and validation operations. Provides methods to create, read, and validate JWT tokens for authentication and authorization.

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken.CreateTokenMethod(System.String,Dapper.API.Models.TokenData)
member.summary: Creates a JWT token for a user with optional custom claims data.
member.param: The unique identifier of the user for whom the token is created.
Optional additional data to include in the token claims.
member.returns: A JWT token string that can be used for authentication.

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken.CreateTokenMethod(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Dapper.API.Models.TokenData)
member.summary: Creates a JWT token for a user on a specific device with optional custom claims data. Useful for scenarios requiring device-specific authentication.
member.param: The unique identifier of the user for whom the token is created.
The identifier of the device from which the user is authenticating.
Optional additional data to include in the token claims.
member.returns: A JWT token string that can be used for authentication.

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken.GetPrincipal(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts the claims principal from a JWT token. This can be used to access the claims within the token for authorization decisions.
member.param: The JWT token string to parse.
member.returns: A ClaimsPrincipal object containing the claims from the token.

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken.ReadToken(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a JWT token to access its raw information without validating it.
member.param: The JWT token string to read.
member.returns: A JwtSecurityToken object representing the decoded token.

member.name: M:Dapper.API.Configure.ICreateToken.ValidateToken(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a JWT token to ensure it is properly signed and not expired.
member.param: The JWT token string to validate.
member.returns: A tuple containing: - isValid: Boolean indicating if the token is valid - userId: The user ID extracted from the token if valid

member.name: T:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail
member.summary: Provides detailed information about an error that occurred in the application. Used for structured error responses in API calls.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.Code
member.summary: A unique code identifying the error type, often corresponding to system error codes. Can be used for error classification and client-side handling logic.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.Message
member.summary: A human-readable description of the error. Should be clear and informative without exposing sensitive system details.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.Component
member.summary: The component or module where the error occurred. Helps in identifying the subsystem responsible for the error.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.Function
member.summary: The specific function or operation that was being performed when the error occurred. Provides context for where in the execution flow the error happened.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.AdditionalData
member.summary: A dictionary containing additional context-specific information about the error. Can include timestamps, request IDs, or other diagnostic information.

member.name: P:Dapper.API.Models.ErrorDetail.ValidationErrors
member.summary: A collection of validation errors when the error is related to invalid input. Each error specifies which property failed validation and why. Only populated for validation-related errors.

member.summary: Error response model
